meanings.sent1: I always prededuct my expenses from my budget to avoid overspending.
meanings.sent2: Remember to prededuct the shipping costs before calculating the total price.
meanings.sent3: It's like prededucting a slice of cake before you even bake it!
meanings.sent4: She prededucted the unnecessary details from her presentation, leaving only the key points.
meanings.sent5: Prededucting the time needed for traffic, she left early for the appointment.

meanings.definition: An amount deducted before the final calculation.
meanings.sent1: The prededuct on my paycheck caught me by surprise.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to include the prededuct in your financial planning.
meanings.sent3: The prededuct on the bill made him double-check his expenses.
meanings.sent4: The prededuct acted as a safety net in case of unexpected costs.
meanings.sent5: She calculated the prededuct carefully to ensure accurate budgeting.
